column4: a while back, an update borked certain Sony Vaio laptops - anyone know what needs to be done to resolve that?  It bombs during boot with "ACPI: read timeout, command = 128"
Try removing "quiet" from the kernel line (in grub)
If I remember correctly, it is some sort of race condition (Linux tries to access something before it is quite ready). Removing the "quiet" slows te boot process down enough for it to work.
